channel.title: Physics
channel.description:
3. Toni has a mass of 45.0 kg and is moving with a speed of 10 m/s when she is forced to slow to 5.00 m/s. Find the work she does to slow down. 4. If Toni in problem number 3 used a force of -423N to slow down, how far did she move in the time she took to slow down?
Stumped on those two. Any help?

item.title: Physics
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

  1. Toni has a mass of 45.0 kg and is moving with a speed of 10 m/s when she is forced to slow to 5.00 m/s. Find the work she does to slow down.

force x distance = work done

  1. If Toni in problem number 3 used a force of -423N to slow down, how far did she move in the time she took to slow down?

Force = mass x acceleration

Read full topic

item.title: Physics
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

protip:
3. difference in kinetic energy, work done = force * distance moved in direction of force.
4. F = ma, determine distnace travelled from initial, final velocities and acceleration.

Read full topic

item.description:
@dclawed wrote:

Do you have any formulas in your book for this, if so please post them, Im in year 9, but Im a clever lad, you would be suprised at my knowledge, albeit I`ve not done this yet, my Dads a Physics/Chemisty/Maths tutor, and my private tutor has a PhD in Physics. At the moment my Dads asleep, but I could help you.
